intro: Streptanthus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Streptanthus boliviensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
